result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:39 AM Defendant Kraig Richard Johnstone not in court. Defendant is in custody at NERCC.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Kraig Richard Johnstone.  Attorney Peter Kruger appears for Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that zoom link was sent to NERCC but NERCC does not appear. Attorney Nelsen notes receipt of State's offer but notes that case will remain unresolved while defendant is at NERCC. Asks for status or trial date when defendant has finished his time at NERCC. State asks for status to allow time for the lab to do testing.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

State- made offer
Att Nelsen- Client is in NERCC, has some things he's trying to accomplish, requests August appearance.
Court sets date

Att Nelsen- received information, not guilty pleas, received offer, discussed with client, he discussed with his MN attorney, requests status
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:57 AM Defendant Kraig Richard Johnstone in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Kraig Richard Johnstone in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness  Officer Matt Swanson, Sworn in and testifies. State-direct examination of witness.  The alledged incident occurred in the City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Witness identifies Defendant. Record will reflect that the defendant has been identified. Attorney Nelsen cross examines witness. State makes objection to question. Court overrules and allows the question. State asks rebuttal questions. Atty Nelsen objects to question. Court overrules and allows the question. State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.
  Arraignment scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

01:35 PM Defendant Kraig Richard Johnstone in court, in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kraig Richard Johnstone appeared by video means.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Court acknowledges Atty Hoffman here today for special appearances. Defendant would like Atty Hoffman to make special appearances.  Atty Hoffman acknowledges complaint and waives further reading. States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State gives extensive criminal history of both Wisconsin and Minnesota. There are several F.T.A.'s in Minnesota and in Wisconsin. Defendant is currently on probation holds in Minnestoa.
Atty Hoffman questions defendant. Defendant has lived in Douglas County his entire life and does have family ties to the area. Defendant is currently not working and is not going to school. Defendant has no money to post.
Court Orders $1000 cash bail with conditions of   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Defendant does want to apply for Public Defendant  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm for Atty Check
